sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 24 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C24, the alternating group A5, or one of the five non-abelian groups of order 24.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups are there of order 24 and what are they?
message_2:
There are 15 non-isomorphic groups of order 24. They are:

1. Z_24 (Cyclic group of order 24)
2. Z_2 x Z_2 x Z_2 x Z_3 (Direct product of cyclic groups)
3. Z_4 x Z_2 x Z_3 (Direct product of cyclic groups)
4. Z_6 x Z_4 (Direct product of cyclic groups)
5. Z_12 x Z_2 (Direct product of cyclic groups)
6. Z_2 x Z_4 x Z_3 (Direct product of cyclic groups)
7. Z_2 x Z_6 x Z_2 (Direct product of cyclic groups)
8. Z_2 x Z_12 (Direct product of cyclic groups)
9. Z_3 x S_3 (Direct product of cyclic group and symmetric group)
10. Z_3 x D_8 (Direct product of cyclic group and dihedral group)
11. Z_3 x Q_8 (Direct product of cyclic group and quaternion group)
12. S_4 (Symmetric group of degree 4)
13. A_4 x Z_2 (Direct product of alternating group and cyclic group)
14. D_12 x Z_2 (Direct product of dihedral group and cyclic group)
15. SL(2,3) (Special linear group of 2x2 matrices over the field with 3 elements)

These groups can be found using the Sylow theorems and considering the possible combinations of Sylow subgroups.
